Dispatcher’s certificate
A candidate for the ATC dispatcher certificate has the following qualifications:

1. age - over 21 years of age;

2. valid medical certificate of class 3;

3. Theoretical training course developed in accordance with the standard programs in a certified ATC and a demonstration of the level of theoretical knowledge in the following areas:

The legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan on the use of airspace of the Republic of Kazakhstan and aviation activities, rules and regulations as they relate to air traffic service, including the rights, duties and responsibilities of the holder of the air traffic controller's qualification mark(s)

principles, use and limitations of the equipment used in ATC, voice communication, information recording, data transmission, radio navigation aids, surveillance and radar systems, automatic dependent surveillance, flight plan processing, display (user interface), operational data and data on operating conditions;

principles of flight, principles of operation and functioning of aircraft, propulsion systems and systems, characteristics of aircraft relevant to ATC;

human capabilities, including the principles of threat and error factor control, as well as team optimization training;

aviation meteorology, application and understanding of meteorological documentation and information, occurrence and characteristics of special weather phenomena which affect flight performance and safety, principle of barometric altitude measurement;

principles of air navigation, principles, limitations and accuracy of navigation systems and visual aids;

procedures for ATC, communication, radio telephony and phraseology exchange normal, abnormal 1 emergency), use of appropriate aviation documentation, practical methods to ensure flight safety.
METAR
Abbreviations and designations ATIS - automatic transmission of information in the aerodrome area;

METAR - regular weather report;

TAF - aerodrome weather forecast;

GAMET - zone forecast for low-altitude flights;

SIGMET - brief description of actual or expected certain weather phenomena along the flight route, which can affect aircraft flight safety;

AIRMET - brief description of actual or expected certain weather phenomena along the flight route, which were not included in the GAMET, and which may affect the aircraft flight safety.
Examples:

METAR: UADD 150530Z 36004MPS 330V050 9999 NSC 27/06 Q1012 NOSIG RMK QFE701/0935

TAF: UAA 110503Z 2806/2906 02003MPS 9999 FEW100 TX27/2809Z TN09/2901Z TEMPO 2806/2812 07004G10MPS BECMG 2812/2813 21003MPS TEMPO 2812/2824 16003MPS BECMG 2902/2903 34003MPS SCT050CB BKN100

GAMET: UASP GAMET VALID 150600/151200 UASP-
